result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin A Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: any sentence currently serving.

Same conditions as probation.
Consecutive to: any sentence currently being served.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must sign up for Probation by Friday June 12, 2015. 
Early discharge from probation may be considered.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must successfully complete drug court.

timeConds.notes: Must complete 40 hours each year on probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin A Krueger in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PSI Waived  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.
Joint Plea agreement;
Count 1 is amended on the information to a  Class F felony MINUS the 2 enhancers
The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty of the amended charge.
Argument by State
Argument by Defense
Defendant relates

Court Orders:   8 years prison
Imposed and Stayed
4 years initial  with 4 years extended supervision
Consecutive to any sentence currently serving.

Probation  4 years - must sign up by Friday.
Condtions of probation:
Must Maintain absolute sobriety
Must successfully complete drug court
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Must pay Court Costs
Must pay Costs   $330 for  "Buy money"
Must complete 40  Hours of Community Service per each year on probation.

Voter rights  & Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence filed.

Early discharge from probation is a possiblility.

Defendant Dustin A Krueger in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Dustin A Krueger in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:09 Cross by Defense.
11:11 Testimony closed.
State request the Court take Judicial Notice of the records attached to the Criminal Complaint. Court takes Judicial Notice of the records attached to the Criminal Complaint.
Court finds probable cause and binds the Defendant over for Trial.
Information filed. Waives formal reading. Not guilty plea entered.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not go on Jefferson Elementary School property.

Defendant Dustin A Krueger in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Defendant Dustin A Krueger in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
